sn15.20:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn15.20:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn15.20:5.2: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.
sn15.20:5.3: Once upon a time, mendicants, this Mount Vepulla came to be labelled Pācīnavaṃsa.
sn15.20:5.4: And at that time people came to be labelled Tivaras.
sn15.20:5.5: The lifespan of the Tivaras was 40,000 years.
sn15.20:5.6: It took them four days to climb Mount Vepulla, and four days to descend.
sn15.20:5.7: At that time Kakusandha, the Blessed One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:5.8: Kakusandha had a fine pair of chief disciples named Vidhura and Sañjīva.
sn15.20:5.9: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have died, and that Buddha has become finally extinguished.
sn15.20:5.13: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.
sn15.20:6.1: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla came to be labelled Vaṅkaka.
sn15.20:6.2: And at that time people came to be labelled Rohitassas.
sn15.20:6.3: The lifespan of the Rohitassas was 40,000 years.
sn15.20:6.4: It took them three days to climb Mount Vepulla, and three days to descend.
sn15.20:6.5: At that time Koṇāgamana, the Blessed One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:6.6: Koṇāgmana had a fine pair of chief disciples named Bhiyyosa and Uttara.
sn15.20:6.7: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have died, and that Buddha has become finally extinguished.
sn15.20:7.1: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla came to be labelled Supassa.
sn15.20:7.2: And at that time people came to be labelled Suppiyas.
sn15.20:7.3: The lifespan of the Suppiyas was 40,000 years.
sn15.20:7.4: It took them two days to climb Mount Vepulla, and two days to descend.
sn15.20:7.5: At that time Kassapa, the Blessed One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.
sn15.20:7.6: Kassapa had a fine pair of chief disciples named Tissa and Bhāradvāja.
sn15.20:7.7: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have died, and that Buddha has become finally extinguished.
sn15.20:8.1: These days this Mount Vepulla has come to be labelled Vepulla.
sn15.20:8.2: And these people have come to be labelled Magadhans.
sn15.20:8.3: The lifespan of the Magadhans is short, limited, and fleeting.
sn15.20:8.4: A long life is a hundred years or a little more.
sn15.20:8.5: It takes the Magadhans an hour to climb Mount Vepulla, and an hour to descend.
sn15.20:8.6: And now I am the Blessed One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha who has arisen in the world.
sn15.20:8.7: I have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.
sn15.20:8.8: There will come a time when this mountain’s name will disappear, those people will die, and I will be finally extinguished.
sn15.20:8.12: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
sn15.20:9.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn15.20:9.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn15.20:11.2: their nature’s to rise and fall;
sn15.20:15.1: The Linked Discourses on the unknown beginning are complete.
